skill.name: tasks-generator
skill.description: Generate structured, actionable task roadmaps from project specifications. This skill analyzes PRD, Tech Specs, and UI/UX documents to create comprehensive task breakdowns organized by phase and sprint with proper dependencies and acceptance criteria.
skill.summary: Generate structured task roadmaps from project specifications with phases, sprints, dependencies, and acceptance criteria.
skill.author: Emz1998

security_audit.summary: All static findings are false positives. The skill contains only documentation files (markdown templates). The 67 'external_command' detections are markdown inline code formatting using backticks. The 33 'weak cryptographic algorithm' detections are documentation placeholders using bracket notation. No executable code, no system access, no network calls, no file system operations. This skill is pure documentation with no security risk.

content.value_statement: Transform PRD, Tech Specs, and UI/UX documents into actionable task breakdowns. This skill creates structured roadmaps with phases, sprints, dependencies, and acceptance criteria for efficient project execution.
actual_capabilities: Analyze PRD documents to extract features, user stories, and MVP requirements
Parse Tech Specs to identify architecture decisions, data models, and API requirements
Extract UI/UX specifications for component development and design system tasks
Organize tasks into three phases: Foundation, Build, and Deployment
Generate sprint-based task lists with sequential IDs and parallel task markers
Apply structured output format with templates for consistent documentation
limitations: Does not execute any code or access the file system directly
Does not integrate with project management tools (Jira, Asana, etc.)
Cannot estimate task duration without explicit specification details
Does not create tickets or issues in external systems

use_cases.title: Sprint Planning for New Features
use_cases.description: Project managers use this skill to break down new feature requirements into actionable sprints. The skill analyzes specifications and generates a complete task breakdown with dependencies, helping teams understand what to build and in what order.

use_cases.title: Onboarding Documentation
use_cases.description: New team members use the generated task roadmaps to understand project structure and implementation order. The phase-based organization (Foundation, Build, Deployment) provides a clear learning path for understanding the codebase.

use_cases.title: Technical Specification Creation
use_cases.description: Business analysts use this skill to validate that technical specifications are complete. The task generation process reveals gaps in requirements by identifying missing information needed to create actionable tasks.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Task Generation
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a task roadmap for a new [feature_name] feature. The specifications are in [spec_file_path]. Include Foundation, Build, and Deployment phases with sprint breakdowns.
prompt_templates.scenario: When you have PRD or Tech Specs and need a complete task breakdown

prompt_templates.title: Sprint-Focused Planning
prompt_templates.prompt: Create sprint tasks for [sprint_name] based on [spec_file_path]. Include parallel-safe tasks marked with [P] and define acceptance criteria for each task.
prompt_templates.scenario: When you need detailed sprint-level task planning with acceptance criteria

prompt_templates.title: Dependency-Aware Breakdown
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate tasks from [spec_file_path] with full dependency analysis. Identify which tasks block others, which can run in parallel, and map the critical path for the project.
prompt_templates.scenario: When you need to understand task dependencies and execution order

prompt_templates.title: Multi-Spec Integration
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an integrated task roadmap combining requirements from [prd_path], [tech_specs_path], and [ux_specs_path]. Cross-reference requirements and ensure no tasks are duplicated.
prompt_templates.scenario: When you have multiple specification documents that need to be synthesized

output_examples.input: Generate a task roadmap for a user authentication feature. The PRD is at .claude/docs/specs/prd.md and Tech Specs are at .claude/docs/specs/tech-specs.md.
output: - T001 [P]: Initialize project with auth dependencies
- T003 [P]: Set up auth type definitions
- T010: Define User and AuthState types

output_examples.input: Break down the following PRD feature into sprints: 'As a user, I want to export my notes as PDF so I can share them offline.'
output: - T027: Define Export types and interfaces
- T032: Add export button to note menu
- T033: Write export service unit tests

best_practices: Provide all relevant specification documents (PRD, Tech Specs, UI/UX) for comprehensive task generation
Review generated tasks for domain-specific knowledge gaps before implementation
Use the parallel task marker [P] to identify work that can be distributed across team members
Define clear acceptance criteria for each task to ensure deliverable quality
anti_patterns: Using generated tasks without reviewing dependencies - critical path items must complete first
Skipping Foundation phase tasks - environment setup and types are prerequisites for all feature work
Creating one task per file instead of per deliverable - tasks should be testable and completable in 2-8 hours
Ignoring the sprint numbering convention - consistency helps with tracking and reporting

faq.question: What specifications does this skill accept as input?
faq.answer: The skill works with PRD (Product Requirements Document), Tech Specs (Technical Specifications), and UI/UX Specs. Provide file paths to these documents for analysis.

faq.question: How detailed are the generated tasks?
faq.answer: Tasks are high-level action items (1-2 days of work). Each task should be broken down further by developers into smaller subtasks if needed.

faq.question: Can I customize the task output format?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill uses a template at assets/tasks-template.md that can be modified. Alternative formats can be requested in the prompt.

faq.question: Does this skill integrate with Jira or other project management tools?
faq.answer: No, the skill generates markdown documentation. You can copy the output into your project management tool manually.

faq.question: How does the skill handle missing specifications?
faq.answer: If specifications are missing or incomplete, the skill will prompt you for the file paths or ask clarifying questions about requirements.

faq.question: What is the recommended workflow for using this skill?
faq.answer: 1) Gather all relevant specifications, 2) Provide file paths to the skill, 3) Review the generated roadmap, 4) Refine tasks based on team capacity, 5) Import into your project management tool.
